translated: Birth Stories
Ten-&-One Collection
The Chapter on the Four Gates
The Nigrodha Birth Story
“I don’t know this,

analyzed: kaḥ vā ayam kassa vāti vā
translated: who he is or whose he is.
Just as a bird flies away,
Nigrodha, what do you think?
Then, with a voice from the sky,
men pulled me out.
After giving me a slap on the face,
they did what the tree-spirit said.
Such is the one with a foolish mind,
unaware of what has been done, ill-disposed.
The tree-spirit did an unmanly act,
to you, his friend, lord of the people.”
“I don’t know this,
nor does anyone tell me,
what you say, my friend,
the reason for the tree-spirit’s action.
The tree-spirit’s friend,
my friend, is my companion.
You are the one who will give us sovereignty,
greatness among men;
I have attained the power of the three knowledges,

analyzed: ettha me na atthi sa sayo
translated: I have no doubt about this.
Just as a seed in a plowed field

analyzed: ḍayhati na virūhati  evam katam asappurise
translated: is burned up and doesn’t grow,🔽so what is done for a bad person

analyzed: nassati na virūhati  kataññumhi ca posamhi
translated: is lost and doesn’t grow.🔽But in a person who repays what has been done,
who is virtuous, of noble character,
As seeds sown in a good field,
What is done does not perish.”
“This Nigrodha, the deceiver,
the thinker of evil thoughts,
Let the executioners kill him with blows,
I do not want him to live.”
“Forgive him, Great King,
do not have him killed;
Forgive, your Majesty, the evil man,
I do not want him to be killed.”
“One should only serve the Nigrodha,
not associate with the Sākha;
Better to die in the Nigrodha,
than to live in the Sākha.”🔽The Nigrodha Jātaka (7th) is finished.
